items.title: What‚Äôs the difference between dolphins and porpoises?
items.content_html:
I was reading an article about an oil spill in the Black Sea and couldn’t recall what the difference is between dolphins and porpoises‚Ä¶

It essentially comes down to their faces (who can forget Flipper‚Äôs famous ‚Äúgrin‚Äù?), their fins, and their figures. Dolphins tend to have prominent, elongated ‚Äúbeaks‚Äù and cone-shaped teeth, while porpoises have smaller mouths and spade-shaped teeth. The dolphin‚Äôs hooked or curved dorsal fin (the one in the middle of the animal‚Äôs back) also differs from the porpoise‚Äôs triangular dorsal fin. Generally speaking, dolphin bodies are leaner, and porpoises‚Äô are portly.

From the National Ocean Service.

üê¨
items.content_text:
I was reading an article about [an oil spill in the Black Sea](https://www.theinertia.com/environment/oil-spill-russia-black-sea-dolphins-dead/) and couldn't recall what the difference is between dolphins and porpoises‚Ä¶

> It essentially comes down to their faces (who can forget Flipper‚Äôs famous ‚Äúgrin‚Äù?), their fins, and their figures. Dolphins tend to have prominent, elongated ‚Äúbeaks‚Äù and cone-shaped teeth, while porpoises have smaller mouths and spade-shaped teeth. The dolphin‚Äôs hooked or curved dorsal fin (the one in the middle of the animal‚Äôs back) also differs from the porpoise‚Äôs triangular dorsal fin. Generally speaking, dolphin bodies are leaner, and porpoises‚Äô are portly.

From the [National Ocean Service](https://oceanservice.noaa.gov/facts/dolphin_porpoise.html).

üê¨

items.title: üì∫ Favourite TV shows from 2024
items.content_html:
There‚Äôs were plenty of good TV shows released last year, here‚Äôs a list of my favourites in no particular order;

Sh≈çgun

When a mysterious European ship is found marooned in a nearby Japanese fishing village, Lord Yoshii Toranaga discovers secrets that could tip the scales of power and devastate his enemies.

The Penguin

Following the events of The Batman (2022), Oz Cobb, a.k.a. the Penguin, makes a play to seize the reins of the crime world in Gotham.

Secret Level

Original stories set within the worlds of iconic video games are featured in this animated anthology series.

Black Doves

Helen embarks on a passionate affair with a man who has no idea what her secret identity is.

The Day of The Jackal

The Jackal is an elusive assassin who makes his living carrying out hits for the highest fee.

Slow Horses - Season 2

Follows a team of British intelligence agents who serve as a dumping ground department of MI5 due to their career-ending mistakes.

Hysteria

Follows a struggling high school heavy metal band of outcasts who use the town’s sudden interest in the occult to start a reputation as a Satanic metal band, until a strange series of events triggers a witch hunt that leads back to them.

Honourable mentions go to Fake, Creature Commandos, The Agency, Twilight Of The Gods, Landman and The Second Best Hospital in the Galaxy.

For reference, here’s a list of the TV shows released in 2024 on IMDB.

items.title: It‚Äôs Fishing & Crabbing We Go, Sea Shanty
items.content_html:
When your wife challenges you to write a sea shanty after seeing your shared calendar notification, you take that challenge‚Ä¶and then maybe you cheat a little a use ChatGPT because after all, you‚Äôre not a song writer üòú

üé£ ü¶Ä

Hi ho, hi ho, it‚Äôs fishing and crabbing we go, With nets in hand, we‚Äôll scour the sand, Hi ho, hi ho!

Hi ho, hi ho, the tides they ebb and flow, We‚Äôll cast our lines and haul the brines, For fishing and crabbing we go!

The salty breeze, it fills the seas, Our traps and bait below, We‚Äôll fill the hold with tales untold, From fishing and crabbing we go!

Hi ho, hi ho, it‚Äôs fishing and crabbing we go, The ocean‚Äôs call, we‚Äôll heed it all, Hi ho, hi ho!

We used to have Stars, Celebrities, and Personalities, in various fields, be it movies, tv, music, sports, etc. Nowadays, according to most media outlets, everyone seemingly is called a Star.

My question would be, if everyone is a star, is anyone actually a star?

items.title: Flawed Decision Making
items.content_html:
None of this passes the sniff test‚Ä¶

Thursday‚Äôs inquiry into the new laws ran for just three hours, with Australians given only a day to lodge submissions.

The government has said it will rely on some form of age-verification technology to implement the restrictions but the details are vague and the technology has not been finalised.

The onus will be on social media companies to add age-verification tools themselves.

The ban involves the highest age limit set by any country, and does not include exemptions for those with parental consent.

There will be no penalties for parents or children who ignore the rules.

I don‚Äôt understand why we are rushing this through? What is being hidden in the legislation? How will the age verification work? How can you determine that I am over the age of 16? Does this become a way to have a national ID system?

Lots of questions, absolutely no answers!

üîó Australia approves social media ban

items.content_html:
Australia’s Actual Deadliest Animal

NCIS found horses killed more people than any other animal in Australia and were responsible for more than 200 deaths over a two-decade period.

So we can now stop all the demonising of sharks, snakes, spiders, stonefish, jellyfish, the blue ring octopus, and all our other little Australian creatures… shit, we have a fair amount of deadly critters here!

PS. Daryl Braithwaite has got some explaining to do…

items.title: Alder Park Sports Club AGM
items.content_html:
I‚Äôve got my first AGM as Treasurer of Alder Park Sports Club this morning, and whilst I‚Äôll be delivering a positive report, my nerves are an absolute train wreck this morning‚Ä¶

Update:

Well that was a major non-event! To hold the meeting we needed to reach a quorum of 25 members, only 16 members showed, including 7 of 9 Board Members.

So now we reconvene next Sunday and as long as more than 2 people arrive, the meeting will go ahead.

items.content_text:
At New Lambton Eagles‚Äô end of season presentation event yesterday, I was awarded Life Membership.

It‚Äôs brilliant to be recognised for the contribution I‚Äôve made to the Club over the last 10 years. I think I‚Äôve held just about every position in the Club, from when Travis was in MiniRoos in 2015 through to Under 15‚Äôs PYL now.

In that time I‚Äôve been a Coach, Manager, Registrar, Groundsmen, Uniform Coordinator, Equipment Coordinator, Game Day Coordinator, Social Media Coordinator, Premier Youth League Boys Coordinator, Club Photographer, IT/IS Manager, and Vice President.

Crazy! ü§™

Looking forward, I‚Äôd like to keep doing the VP role for another year, along with having greater involvement in the NPL Men‚Äôs Program. We‚Äôll see what shakes out at the AGM next month, which sort of times in with the new NPL Men‚Äôs squad‚Äôs first session.

Go the Eagles! ü¶Ö

items.content_text:
üîó The Instagram Changes Are Not Enough

I think the solution to keep minors safe on social media requires a combination of social media companies, hardware companies, and parents.

It's easy to point the finger and demand a Government response to the growing issue of online safety for kids on social media, and of course they should play a part in it.

However, as we are the ones that buy our kids mobile devices that access these social media networks, we need to take responsibility and be the ones that are managing how our kids are accessing these ones.

I'm not kidding myself for one second thinking that our kids won't try and find a way around whatever restrictions we apply, but if we're not trying and we're just passing the buck, then what example are we setting for our kids.

items.content_text:
WordPress.org bans WP Engine, blocks it from accessing its resources

WordPress drama went up another notch on Wednesday after WordPress.org, the open-source web hosting software, banned hosting provider WP Engine from accessing its resources.

Well that escalated rapidly!

You'd hate to be a WP Engine customer at the moment, caught in the middle of the drama, not being able to auto-update plugins, wondering whether to move to a different host, or even a different platform!

This will get worse before it gets better, I'm not confident WordPress or WP Engine will make smart decisions here.

‚òπÔ∏è

Super interesting doco on the bias that exists in AI. Very good watch.

When MIT Media Lab researcher Joy Buolamwini discovers that facial recognition does not see dark-skinned faces accurately, she embarks on a journey to push for the first-ever U.S. legislation against bias in algorithms that impact us all.

Coded Bias on IMDB.

items.content_text:
A quick and easy taco seasoning for when you forget to pickup some at the store.

  • 1 1/2 tsp Garlic Powder
  • 1 tsp Onion Powder
  • 1 tsp Dried Oregano
  • 1 tsp Cumin
  • 2 tsp Paprika
  • 1/2 tsp chilli flakes
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1/2 tsp black pepper

Combine it all in a small bowl and use as a seasoning on beef mince, pork mince, or chicken mince. üåÆ

items.content_text:
Whilst I‚Äôve not been a huge gambler, aside from when I was doing matched betting, I still had accounts at TAB, Dabble, Betfair, and others, on my phone and found myself putting $100 on here and there when I was bored.

So dumb.

So part of this ADHD thing is to remove as many of the bad triggers as possible‚Ä¶or at least slow access to them. With that in mind, my phone is now gambling app free.

items.content_html:
Since getting my ADHD assessment the other day, everything has been turned up to 10,000 in my brain. I‚Äôm remembering all sorts of random incidents as far back as a 5 year old and now they all make sense to me, the incident, the reaction, the fallout‚Ä¶in a way it‚Äôs actually made it even more difficult to quiet my brain, but this is the pathway to a full diagnosis and treatment.

It‚Äôs just going to be a tough journey, hopefully a better me on the other side.
items.content_text:
Since getting my ADHD assessment the other day, everything has been turned up to 10,000 in my brain. I‚Äôm remembering all sorts of random incidents as far back as a 5 year old and now they all make sense to me, the incident, the reaction, the fallout‚Ä¶in a way it‚Äôs actually made it even more difficult to quiet my brain, but this is the pathway to a full diagnosis and treatment.

It‚Äôs just going to be a tough journey, hopefully a better me on the other side.

items.content_html: Started down the pathway of getting my self-diagnosed ADHD formally diagnosed and treated, it‚Äôs at a point now where I‚Äôm either constantly depressed or overachieving and on top of the world. There is little to no middle ground anymore.

items.title: Newy lockdown 2
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Today, it was announced that Newcastle and the surrounding areas will stay in lockdown for another week as the daily number of positive COVID cases are still too high. So I guess that gives me at least another week of home schooling fun. Yay...

It hasn't all been bad though, I've been able to dedicate more time to the projects I've been working on. I've been able to dive into Saga: Compendium One, which is so good. I've also been able to spend some time playing with the video we've been capturing at New Lambton FC, which I'll start sharing on New Lambton's social media in the coming days.

At the moment, I'm guessing we'll be in lockdown for at least 3 weeks. Hopefully I'll be wrong!

New Lambton went on to win this match 4-1.

items.title: Newy lockdown
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
The end of the first week of lockdown in Newcastle isn't too far away, however, with the rising numbers of local cases I can't see it ending this week though. It doesn't make a huge difference to my every day life during the week, the biggest difference comes on the weekends when there's no football on, at least it's letting me catch up on the backlog of editing that's sitting in Lightroom currently.

Hope you and yours are staying safe wherever you happen to be.

items.title: Oh Karen...
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
Just got told off by a young Karen for flying my drone over a public park, with nobody in it, whilst I was doing a job for a client.

Apparently, being a licensed drone operator, with my radio handy to make sure there was no other air traffic in the area, wasn't good enough...and I quote, "you can keep saying you're a licensed pilot but it doesn't make any difference, you're not allowed to fly over a public park".

Did I mention that there wasn't anybody in the park whilst I was flying, until her dog ran in (off-leash, in a non-off-leash park, but I decided not to be that person) and started barking at my drone, which I then landed back where I took off?

Did I mention that it's not illegal to fly in a public park where I live?

Did I also mention I'm a licensed drone operator?

items.content_html:
Drone captures chilling moment Great White shark stalks swimmers at NSW beach

I love that there are sharks in the waters, it‚Äôs a good sign of an eco system beginning to recover…but the video that Sunrise put together for the story is disgusting!

I don‚Äôt understand why the media needs to constantly demonise these animals! Why the flashing red, why call it a scene ‚Äústraight from a horror movie‚Äù, why the menacing tone? There‚Äôs no way those swimmers are in danger from the shark, it‚Äôs not ‚Äústalking‚Äù them, it‚Äôs trying to find fish amongst the breakers. If it wanted to eat the people, this video would not be safe to view!

The media just needs to stop the over dramatisation of these events. Embrace that our waters are starting to recover from over fishing, embrace the environmental aspect of this, and for crying out loud, let’s try to educate people!
items.content_text: Drone captures chilling moment Great White shark stalks swimmers at NSW beach I love that there are sharks in the waters, it‚Äôs a good sign of an eco system beginning to recover...but the video that Sunrise put together for the story is disgusting! I don‚Äôt understand why the media needs to constantly demonise these animals! Why the flashing red, why call it a scene ‚Äústraight from a horror movie‚Äù, why the menacing tone? There‚Äôs no way those swimmers are in danger from the shark, it‚Äôs not ‚Äústalking‚Äù them, it‚Äôs trying to find fish amongst the breakers. If it wanted to eat the people, this video would not be safe to view! The media just needs to stop the over dramatisation of these events. Embrace that our waters are starting to recover from over fishing, embrace the environmental aspect of this, and for crying out loud, let's try to educate people!

items.title: Site Update
items.content_html:
For the 432nd time in the last 10 years, I’ve decided that I don’t need to have separate websites for my photography, freelance development work, and personal blog.

I’d always thought I should keep work and personal stuff well separated, now that I’m older and wiser, I realise that I should keep it together as they’re both very much connected.

I’ve been really enjoying the work of photographer Jeremy Cowart of late, you should check it out, and one thing that he does that I’m a fan of is not only share his work, but also share things going on in his life and with his family, you can often see how the two influence each other.

So what does that mean for the website here?

Expect to see a whole load of different focal points, I work in a few different spaces, I’m also involved in the administration of a football club, I love tech stuff, I play video games, I’m a Dad, I’m a husband, there’s no end to the sort of stuff I can publish here!

items.content_html:
OS X, Lightroom, and the new Photos App:

I‚Äôve been using Photos App for several months now (since the first beta was made available). It‚Äôs now a major part of my photography workflow, and, therefore, my life.¬†

So, here‚Äôs a basic outline of my workflow.

I quite like Kenneth’s workflow, I might adopt something similar with Lightroom CC and Apple Photos. Also doesn’t matter what device I’m on, it works on my MacBook Pro and iPad Pro.
items.content_text:
OS X, Lightroom, and the new Photos App:
Earlier this week, OS X 10.10.3 was released, which includes the much-anticipated new Photos app ‚Äî Apple‚Äôs full replacement for both iPhoto and Aperture.¬† I‚Äôve been using Photos App for several months now (since the first beta was made available). It‚Äôs now a major part of my photography workflow, and, therefore, my life.¬† So, here‚Äôs a basic outline of my workflow.
I quite like Kenneth's workflow, I might adopt something similar with Lightroom CC and Apple Photos. Also doesn't matter what device I'm on, it works on my MacBook Pro and iPad Pro.

items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
The FA Cup, also known officially as The Football Association Challenge Cup, is an annual knockout football competition in men's domestic English football. First played during the 1871‚Äì72 season, it is the oldest national football competition in the world.[1] It is organised by and named after The Football Association (The FA). Since 2015, it has been known as The Emirates FA Cup after its headline sponsor. A concurrent women's tournament is also held, the FA Women's Cup.
‚Äî Read on en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/FA_Cup

items.content_text:
The EFL Cup (referred to historically, and colloquially, as the League Cup), currently known as the Carabao Cup for sponsorship reasons, is an annual knockout football competition in men's domestic English football. Organised by the English Football League (EFL), it is open to any club within the top four levels of the English football league system ‚Äì 92 clubs in total ‚Äì comprising the top level Premier League, and the three divisions of the English Football League's own league competition (Championship, League One and League Two).

Info from https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/EFL_Cup

This is part of my "saved info" series, where I save links to subjects I've researched online.

items.content_html: Over the weekend, we had our Club Presentation Day, somehow I was voted Club Person of The Year, which was quite surprising and also very awesome. It’s nice to be recognised for all the work I’ve been putting in.
items.content_text: Over the weekend, we had our Club Presentation Day, somehow I was voted Club Person of The Year, which was quite surprising and also very awesome. It's nice to be recognised for all the work I've been putting in.

items.content_html:
I have a love/hate relationship with building websites. I love building websites for other people, especially when they know what they want. When it comes to building one for myself, ugh, it’s the worst.

After getting my remote pilots license, I figured I better get something together to show that I’m available for hire, the sort of work I do, and some examples of what I’ve done already, so of course, I’m building a website for myself.

In reality, it should be pretty easy to put it together, but of course, it’s not.

When it comes to making decisions as to what element to put where, what to include, what to leave out, and all the other sorts of questions a web designer/developer would ask to get them moving on a project, I just cannot settle on any answers.

So frustrating!

Not 100% sure how to progress, I guess I’m probably best off throwing something/anything on the website and then refining it a little later on…it doesn’t need to be perfect at launch!

items.content_html:
I passed all the tests for my Remote Pilots License, just waiting on CASA to issue the actual license and it’ll all be official.

I should probably update my LinkedIn profile to add the license in, as well as putting the details on all my business operations stuff, might be helpful for booking more drone work in the future.

items.content_html:
Soooo, I’m going to be managing New Lambton FC’s website, along with their social media accounts, and that’s prompted me to move my own blog back to WordPress so that I’m working with the same set of tools for everything.

My plan is to migrate my old posts to the new platform, currently they’re on micro.blog but I’m having a problem with the export file that mb creates. I’ll probably connect it all to Facebook and Instagram, again, this is so that I’ve got the same familiar setup as what’s on the NLFC website.
items.content_text: Soooo, I'm going to be managing New Lambton FC's website, along with their social media accounts, and that's prompted me to move my own blog back to WordPress so that I'm working with the same set of tools for everything. My plan is to migrate my old posts to the new platform, currently they're on micro.blog but I'm having a problem with the export file that mb creates. I'll probably connect it all to Facebook and Instagram, again, this is so that I've got the same familiar setup as what's on the NLFC website.

items.content_html: Has anyone tried exporting their posts from micro.blog and importing them on WordPress? I’m getting a weird error saying there’s “no authors in your import file”.
items.content_text: Has anyone tried exporting their posts from micro.blog and importing them on WordPress? I'm getting a weird error saying there's "no authors in your import file".

items.title: Testing Day One as a Commonplace Book
items.content_html:
I’ve gone off on a slight tangent in my efforts to find a replacement to Evernote to use as a CommonPlace book and am testing out Day One and it’s ability to handle various types of info I throw at it, along with being able to recall said info.

So far I’ve been able to capture text quotes and images from websites without any issue, on both iOS and MacOS, I have also intergrated Day One with IFTTT which opens up a world of automated information capture, for example; - save a daily weather report to Day One - articles I favourite in Pocket get pushed to Day One - posts from my micro.blog get pushed to Day One - checkins on Swarm get pushed to Day One
items.content_text: I've gone off on a slight tangent in my efforts to find a replacement to Evernote to use as a CommonPlace book and am testing out Day One and it's ability to handle various types of info I throw at it, along with being able to recall said info. items.title: Rooting around on DreamHost VPS
items.content_html:
So I’m finally making progress towards installing TiddlyWiki on my DreamHost VPS.

I’ve got shell access to my DreamHost VPS, I am able to install node.js, I can check the version installed, along with listing the other nvm modules that are installed…. And then I try to install install TiddlyWiki and just get slapped around with a bunch of npm errors, basically saying I need to be the root user.

Unfortunately, DreamHost doesn’t allow root access to the VPS product, I need to upgrade to a Dedicated Server, or move to their DreamCompute product, which are completely unmanaged, hence the allowance for root access.

Now I need to find a work around, which may involve having DreamHost run the installer for me, assuming they will, or I’ll need to look at relocating my server to Digital Ocean or somewhere similar.

items.title: All Aboard the Wiki Train
items.content_html:
Today’s tinker project is to setup TiddlyWiki.

I’ve decided that a wiki is a good place to locate all those little snippets of information I collect, which currently end up spread between plain text files in Dropbox, some marked up notes in Notes.app, and an assortment of PDFs spread across Dropbox, Files.app, and a myriad of other locations.

A wiki is a good place to store this sort of information, I can get to it anywhere I have an Internet connection, using the Quine iOS app I can take files offline with me, along with being able create new files offline and sync them later.

Now for the real challenge;

Decisions, decisions!
items.content_text:
Today's tinker project is to setup TiddlyWiki. I've decided that a wiki is a good place to locate all those little snippets of information I collect, which currently end up spread between plain text files in Dropbox, some marked up notes in Notes.app, and an assortment of PDFs spread across Dropbox, Files.app, and a myriad of other locations. A wiki is a good place to store this sort of information, I can get to it anywhere I have an Internet connection, using the Quine iOS app I can take files offline with me, along with being able create new files offline and sync them later. Now for the real challenge;
  • do I use one of my existing domain names or do I buy a new domain?
  • if I use an existing domain, do I go the subdomain route?
  • do I make it public or do I keep it private?
Decisions, decisions!

items.title: Some Thoughts On Using Facebook Again
items.content_html:
Almost all of my friends are still on Facebook, and whilst I don’t want to use Facebook again, I can see some value in having an account there just to be able to communicate with friends.

I won’t publish anything to Facebook, directly or indirectly, nor will I crosspost from my blog to Facebook. This is not about gaining views or anything like that.

I’m wondering how minimal an account can be on Facebook, i.e. how much information will I have to provide Facebook. Can I simply provide an email address and password, or will they demand more…I know they want more, but what is the “minimum viable Facebook” configuration?

How much activity / tracking can I block? Can I make it so that I cannot be tagged in photos, posts, groups, etc. ?

What about the Facebook app, do I need it on my phone, or can I just use the web app? Does the web app allow you to block stuff, are its privacy settings comparable to the iOS version? If I do use the iOS app, can I block access to location, microphone, and other sensors?

I wish I had of given Facebook this much thought before I used it previously, hindsight is 20/20, of course.

I’m still not entirely convinced that this is a good idea…

items.content_html:
üîó Trump‚Äôs 2020 reelection campaign wants to push for government control of 5G networks

We went through something similar in Australia recently with our National Broadband Network (NBN) build, to say that it was an almighty cock up is an understatement.

Not only did the build budget blow out massively, and it is still not completed. In areas where it has been completed, customer satisfaction is low, just like the network speeds, in many cases the NBN is slower than the network it replaced.

If the Government wants to build this sort of infrastructure, it needs to be a non-political build, i.e. don’t make it a campaign issue. Internet access should be considered a standard utility just like electricity.
items.content_text: üîó Trump‚Äôs 2020 reelection campaign wants to push for government control of 5G networks We went through something similar in Australia recently with our National Broadband Network (NBN) build, to say that it was an almighty cock up is an understatement. Not only did the build budget blow out massively, and it is still not completed. In areas where it has been completed, customer satisfaction is low, just like the network speeds, in many cases the NBN is slower than the network it replaced. If the Government wants to build this sort of infrastructure, it needs to be a non-political build, i.e. don't make it a campaign issue. Internet access should be considered a standard utility just like electricity.

items.content_html:
üîó Japanese government plans to hack into citizens' IoT devices

Look, there is a certain merit to what the Japanese Government has proposed, however, it‚Äôs not a huge leap to suggest that this ‚Äúaudit‚Äù will end up in the wrong hands at some point in time, nor that it will actually lead to people fixing their security flawed passwords.

Mark my words, this will not end well…and nor should it
items.content_text:
üîó Japanese government plans to hack into citizens' IoT devices
Many have argued that this is an unnecessary step, as the same results could be achieved by just sending a security alert to all users, as there's no guarantee that the users found to be using default or easy-to-guess passwords would change their passwords after being notified in private.
Look, there is a certain merit to what the Japanese Government has proposed, however, it‚Äôs not a huge leap to suggest that this ‚Äúaudit‚Äù will end up in the wrong hands at some point in time, nor that it will actually lead to people fixing their security flawed passwords. Mark my words, this will not end well...and nor should it

items.title: Vietnam, January ‚Äò03
items.content_html:
I had just bought my first digital camera, a Minolta Dimage 7, prior to going on this trip. The Dimage 7 was, at the time, one of the best digital cameras going around, and it was damn expensive too, not to mention the cost of buying CF cards. Looking back at the photos now, it’s hard to tell just how good the Dimage 7 was, there’s just so much “noise” in the photos.

Anyway, here are a few photos that I took back then, edited in VSCO for iPad.
items.content_text: I had just bought my first digital camera, a Minolta Dimage 7, prior to going on this trip. The Dimage 7 was, at the time, one of the best digital cameras going around, and it was damn expensive too, not to mention the cost of buying CF cards. Anyway, here are a few photos that I took back then, edited in VSCO for iPad.

I‚Äôll preface this with saying I am decidedly against likes on Micro. - Josh Sullivan

Personally, I think ‚Äúsimple‚Äù liking is the scourge of the social Internet and adds little to no value to anyone, unless you‚Äôre using ‚Äúliking‚Äù as a bookmark type thing, which is what my wife does instead of using an actual bookmarking service.

That said, I often ‚Äúlike‚Äù other peoples posts using Indigenous, however, when they Micropub to my blog they do so ‚ÄúPrivately‚Äù and I can then choose to add a comment or pull-quote later, and then publish it publicly.

items.content_html:
Alcohol in the Hunter - more than 3000 treatments in a year | Newcastle Herald

The alcohol problem was followed by three illegal drugs. The data showed about 2223 ‚Äútreatment periods‚Äù a year for amphetamines, 1739 for cannabis and 477 for heroin.¬†

This so-called ‚Äútreatment period‚Äù refers¬†to contact between a client and publicly-funded health service at government and non-government agencies.

Alcohol is clearly a huge issue here in Australia, and many other countries in the World, and whilst I think there is more and more education needed, I doubt that it will ever be an issue that gets solved as the Government makes so much money from it.

The other stat I find interesting is the number of people who entered into treatment for Cannabis. I bet that the vast majority of people who entered into a treatment ‚Äúcontract‚Äù did so to avoid a conviction being recorded against them as there is little to no evidence that cannabis causes issues anything like alcohol does.

Alcohol is clearly a huge issue here in Australia, and many other countries in the World, and whilst I think there is more and more education needed, I doubt that it will ever be an issue that gets solved as the Government makes so much money from it. The other stat I find interesting is the number of people who entered into treatment for Cannabis. I bet that the vast majority of people who entered into a treatment ‚Äúcontract‚Äù did so to avoid a conviction being recorded against them as there is little to no evidence that cannabis causes issues anything like alcohol does.

items.content_text:

items.content_html:
I’m looking for a new RSS reader. I really don’t like the latest update to Feedly, in particular how they’ve changed the long press/force touch mechanism.

Instead of being able to assign force touch directly to an outcome, i.e. Save to Pocket, you’re now forced to do it via the share sheet. With just that extra step, it’s taking me a lot longer to triage my feeds now.

Any suggestions?

items.content_html:
So, my back has improved significantly since I got the injection the other week, I sat down with my GP yesterday to discuss next steps and she surprised me by stating that I can stop taking one of the pain relief medications that I’ve been on, Palexia SR. Overall, this is a good thing stopping taking this opioid, however, the next couple of weeks could be interesting based on the medication data sheet.

Here’s my favourite part…

I suggested to my wife that I might need some time alone over the next week or two…
items.content_text:
So, my back has improved significantly since I got the injection the other week, I sat down with my GP yesterday to discuss next steps and she surprised me by stating that I can stop taking one of the pain relief medications that I've been on, Palexia SR. Overall, this is a good thing stopping taking this opioid, however, the next couple of weeks could be interesting based on the medication data sheet. Here's my favourite part...
Some people may feel unwell if they suddenly stop taking PALEXIA¬Æ SR. If you suddenly stop taking PALEXIA¬Æ SR you may experience withdrawal symptoms such as:
  • restlessness
  • watery eyes or runny nose
  • sweating or chills
  • muscle pain
  • dilated pupils
  • irritability or anxiety
  • backache or joint pain
  • weakness
  • abdominal cramps
  • difficulty in sleeping
  • nausea, loss of appetite
  • vomiting or diarrhea
  • increases in blood pressure, breathing or heart rate
I suggested to my wife that I might need some time alone over the next week or two...

items.content_text:
BUG - shortcuts app crash - iOSBeta
Try to go into your Language and Region, under Settings / General Settings... When I clicked to see the other options. It was an ‚ÄúEnglish (US)‚Äù below it.
Ugh, this is something that had been bugging me for ages, it had made Shortcuts unusable as it would crash on opening! I set mine to Australia, and now it works.

Choosing Your Markdown Editor: A Comparison of Ulysses and Drafts

I’m a fan of Drafts, in fact, I’m using it to publish this link. I’ve tried Ulysses, it seems like it could be a very good tool for those who write a lot, but I don’t and I found a few things I didn’t really like about it. Each to their own, right.
items.content_text:
Choosing Your Markdown Editor: A Comparison of Ulysses and Drafts
Ulysses and Drafts are both extraordinary apps. They each sit at the top of the heap of iOS Markdown editors, offering unique strengths that may appeal more to one type of user or another.
I'm a fan of Drafts, in fact, I'm using it to publish this link. I've tried Ulysses, it seems like it could be a very good tool for those who write a lot, but I don't and I found a few things I didn't really like about it. Each to their own, right.

I’ve moved my domain / blog back to my own server, previously hosted on micro.blog, as I’ve started working on a larger project and so I needed to really re-familiarise myself with WordPress and managing servers and all the fun stuff that goes along with owning ones content.

I might also post an ordered list;

items.content_html:
Finally, validation that people who drink black coffee are psychopaths

Seems a bit harsh, but there may be a bit of truth to it…
items.content_text:
Finally, validation that people who drink black coffee are psychopaths
researchers asked 1,000 adults about their food preferences and also administered personality tests that help identify narcissism, psychopathy, aggression, and more. And surprise surprise, people who like bitter foods (such as black coffee) were more likely to exhibit not only psychopathy but also sadism.
Seems a bit harsh, but there may be a bit of truth to it...

items.content_html:
The Secret To Getting Great Sleep Is…Socks

Personally, I hate wearing socks to bed, and if I do, I don‚Äôt sleep very well at all. The part of Australia that I live in doesn‚Äôt get that cold in winter, but it does get pretty warm and sticky in summer, and wearing socks to bed would only exacerbate the problem.

The actual secret to great sleep is to test out what actually works for you, track your sleep, do a little research on different ‚Äúmethods‚Äù of getting good sleep, and experiment with them till you find what works well for you.

I get my best sleep by not drinking alcohol after 4-5pm, walking more than 6,000 steps in a day, and by having a vape before bed. Following this routine, and being in bed before 11pm, I can pretty much guarantee an 8 hour sleep, with a solid 2 hour block of deep sleep.
items.content_text:
The Secret To Getting Great Sleep Is...Socks
Of course studies on the positive effects of bed socks have focused on cool, winter environments
Personally, I hate wearing socks to bed, and if I do, I don‚Äôt sleep very well at all. The part of Australia that I live in doesn‚Äôt get that cold in winter, but it does get pretty warm and sticky in summer, and wearing socks to bed would only exacerbate the problem. The actual secret to great sleep is to test out what actually works for you, track your sleep, do a little research on different ‚Äúmethods‚Äù of getting good sleep, and experiment with them till you find what works well for you. I get my best sleep by not drinking alcohol after 4-5pm, walking more than 6,000 steps in a day, and by having a vape before bed. Following this routine, and being in bed before 11pm, I can pretty much guarantee an 8 hour sleep, with a solid 2 hour block of deep sleep.

items.title: Don't Frustrate Your Customers
items.content_html:
This morning, my boss asks me to do up some artwork for a display plinth for an upcoming conference. I contact the display maker to get the layout information from them, I also ask them if they have an Illustrator template that I can use, a pretty simple question, so I thought…

They respond with a “No, we don’t have an Illustrator Template, but here’s a PDF with the dimensions written on it” . After doing a CMD+I on the PDF they sent me, I learn that it was made in Illustrator…. üôá

It’s so frustrating that they won’t / can’t supply such a simple thing. This would easily enhance their sales offering and allow business’s like ours, who don’t have a marketing / design department, to get more work done by them. I have enough design chops to put logos and images into layers in Illustrator, but not the chops to setup the template to start with so that the bleeds and what-not are correct.

After a quick meet with my boss to tell him what was going on, he decided to cancel the order for the plinths we had with them, with a suggestion that they “create” some templates that they can share with their customers, or at least offer a design fee to do the complete job.

items.content_html:
I’m on a mission to get my sh!t back together, i.e. get back in shape, so I’ve been working through re-setting up my account on Exist.io, getting the various QS logging apps on my iPhone up to date, and last but not least, sorting out a food logging app.

Here’s a quick, opinionated, overview of 3 apps that I’ve tested in the last 24 hours. The way I‚Äôm judging them is by ease of food input, integration with Apple Health, integration with a couple of ‚Äúsmart‚Äù health devices that I already own.

An on-boarding issue prevented me from being able to use it. Apparently I had setup an account with them before, and I can’t recall the password, but it doesn’t let me try to reset it, and there’s no way to bypass it during on-boarding process on my iPhone. The other thing that irks me is that the height and weight is in imperial during the on-boarding, and doesn’t ask me if it’s like to change it.

Simple on-boarding process, collects your age, height, and weight, allows changing units to metric, and asks you how much you want to lose/gain, before presenting you with some dieting options, some free, some paid. Basic logging is quick and easy, it also includes the macros, which is important if you’re following a particular diet. Disappointingly, you can‚Äôt import recipes from a URL or another app, which sucks, and you also can‚Äôt log your foods via your account on their website, which also sucks, and makes me not want to use it.

On-boarding was simple, caveat - I‚Äôve done it before. Metrics can be changed easily to kilograms and centimetres, it’s easy to choose between calories and kilojoules. My favourite feature is that you can easily import recipes from URLs, you can also log your foods via your account on their website, so you’re not stuck in a mobile-only place.

At this point, I‚Äôll be sticking with MyFitnessPal due to the ease of entry mainly. It‚Äôs not the prettiest app, Lifesum wins that category, but functionality wise MFP has everything I want / need in it, now I just have to keep using it.

items.content_html:
I used to be such a crappy sleeper, always waking up in the middle of the night, never being able to get back to sleep, averaging between 5-6 hours a night, now look at me.

I basically avoid alcohol as much as possible, i.e. I don’t drink to relax after work any more (which sounds quite toxic to write), and when we’re away on holidays or at a social thing, I try to limit the amount I drink, along with not drinking after 4-5pm where possible.

Obviously, there are times when this is not possible and I end up having a couple of beers or wines, I just have to know that I will sleep like crap on these nights, and that’s OK.

items.title: First Impressions of the new OURA Ring
items.content_html:
Oooh, new OURA ring just arrived, finally. I pre-ordered it back in December, quite surprised it took this long for it to arrive.

First impressions, packaging is very nicely done, quite “Apple” like, and 100% recyclable, bonus points for that. The new charger should be easier to use than the old one, plus it’s USB C, and last but not least, the new ring looks nicer than the last version with the big lump on it.

More thoughts after I charge it and wear it for a few days.

More thoughts after I charge it and wear it for a few days.

items.title: Migrating to Micro.blog
items.content_html:
I’ve finally made the decision to archive my old matpacker.com blog and re-direct the domain name to my Micro.blog account. I’ve setup the Github mirroring, so I’ve always got that as a backup.

I may run a local install of WordPress on my laptop so that I can edit up the old posts, re-attach photos, etc. and then maybe import that to Micro.blog, however, that’s a long term project I can worry about later. I think the biggest issue will be fixing old blog posts where I had the photos hosted elsewhere, i.e. flickr, S3, etc. Pretty sure I still have all the images, but it’d be nice to consolidate them to a single location.

Ugh, I’m also supposed to be working while I’m doing this…

items.title: Jets vs Mariners, pre-season trial match
items.content_html:
The Newcastle Jets played a decent game yesterday, against the Mariners, with it being a 2-2 draw.

Fairly positive football considering the recent loss of Joey Champness, and the lack of an out and out striker. It was also good to see the response to the Mariners scoring first, not only did they even the score up pretty quickly, they then went ahead and held the lead till very late in the game.

Ronny Vargas looked good, as did Dimi Petratos, Steven Ugarkovic, and Nikolai Toppor-Stanley. Noah James made some great saves, however, that first goal was a bit ordinary, but I’m sure he’ll learn from the experience.

‚öΩÔ∏è

items.content_html:
Quite curious as to how micro.blog handles sharing a video from YouTube.

[youtube www.youtube.com/watch

So, you have to grab the iframe embed code as the straight URL doesn’t parse like it does on say WordPress, Twitter, Facebook, etc. It also doesn’t show in the firehose feed, it’s only shown as a video on your custom domain, there’s not even a link or any reference to it on the main feed, feels like it should at least show a link or something.
items.content_text:
Quite curious as to how micro.blog handles sharing a video from YouTube.

[youtube [www.youtube.com/watch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6L68XIics5c&w=560&h=315])

So, you have to grab the iframe embed code as the straight URL doesn't parse like it does on say WordPress, Twitter, Facebook, etc. It also doesn't show in the firehose feed, it's only shown as a video on your custom domain, there's not even a link or any reference to it on the main feed, feels like it should at least show a link or something.

items.content_html:
I frequently see these really long captions on Instagram, but I can’t seem to get it to work on my Instagram. I follow the rules of no spacing, no emojis after spaces, etc. but it just doesn’t seem to work properly for me.

Often I see people post long stories with paragraphs, actual paragraphs on an Instagram photo. Seriously, how does that even work, and why wouldn’t Instagram just let us post proper stories as our captions, they hide it all behind a “more” link anyway, why not support it out of the box instead?

#lotsofhastags #howmanyistoomany #notadogpic #notafoodpic #anotherunrelatedtag #howdoesoneinstagram #ineedacoffee

items.content_html: Instagram has been weird for me the last 24 hours. I posted this photo with a description, the description deleted as soon as the image was live, then I started getting the dreaded “there’s a link in your post” error. The wasn’t any links in the post, there wasn’t even an emoji in the post. No idea what was going on. This morning I did some research, nothing conclusive as to what was causing the problem, so I tried liking a post from Instagram on my iPad, it worked…weird. So then I deleted Instagram from my iPhone, reinstalled it, and now I can like people photos again. It’s yet to be confirmed if I can edit / post a caption on this photo though…here goes nothing
items.content_text: Instagram has been weird for me the last 24 hours. I posted this photo with a description, the description deleted as soon as the image was live, then I started getting the dreaded "there's a link in your post" error. The wasn't any links in the post, there wasn't even an emoji in the post. No idea what was going on. This morning I did some research, nothing conclusive as to what was causing the problem, so I tried liking a post from Instagram on my iPad, it worked...weird. So then I deleted Instagram from my iPhone, reinstalled it, and now I can like people photos again. It's yet to be confirmed if I can edit / post a caption on this photo though...here goes nothing
